availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Roberts (Harrison County, Kentucky, laborer and trader.)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, laborer and trader. Kentucky native. Son of Benson Roberts and Mary Roberts. Married to Nannie M. Kimbrough in Harrison County, Kentucky, on April 11, 1861. Laborer in Harrison County in 1850. Household owned seventeen enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1850. Trader in Cynthiana in 1860. Household sixteen enslaved persons in Cynthiana in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 170A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 437.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Cynthiana, p. 581.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Cynthiana, p. 122A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, Film #000216896, p. 220.
"William H Roberts (1831-1920)," Find A Grave, Memorial #86475029, accessed January 26, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/86475029.
